reviews.text: Stayed here recently and had the best nights sleep in a long time! The beds and pillows were so comfy, I wish I could take them with me! The food was enjoyable in the the restaurant.
reviews.title: lovely view

reviews.text: The check in girl was lovely and I think the policy of not shouting out your room number if you are a lone female traveller is an excellent idea.
reviews.title: Great Premier Inn and Pub

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have no issues staying here, or any other Premier Inn.
reviews.title: Consistent Quality with a Yorkshire welcome

reviews.text: Stayed here, normal Premier Inn standards, staff friendly and next door to Brewers Fayre, again staff very friendly and food great, after a 70 mile bike ride
reviews.title: Clean and tidy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visit this hotel about 3 or 4 times a year. Firstly it is great to find a hotel a few hundreds from the main dual carriageway into Hull but quiet with open views of countryside.
reviews.title: By the bridge

reviews.text: This was my second stay in two weeks. The welcome from Becky was spot on. We were given a warm greeting, all the information we needed and told about the 'Good night guarantee' from Premier Inns. The room was clean, lovely comfy bed, good temperature, great shower and no noise at all! The attached 'Home Farm' Brewers Fayre restaraunt and bar serves wholesome pub food at good prices and great special deals. I'll be back again next week!!
reviews.title: Quiet, comfy, good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have used this hotel on several occassions and found it excellent vale. It is well placed bear the Humber Bridge and only 5 mins drive from Priory Park and Ride. There is a large Brewers Fayre joined on to the hotel that provides good value meals. It is also ideal for use as a base if visiing the Yorkshire coast or York only 1 hour away.
reviews.title: Very Good Value

reviews.text: Clean, good sized room, helpful staff, quiet, comfortable night's sleep. All I wanted really. (Didn't have any of the food as I arrived in time for bed and left for a breakfast meeting.)
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, can recommend

reviews.text: I had a very good welcome upon arrival at the Premier Inn; the receptionist was very knowledgeable and helpful, advising of the options for breakfast and evening meal and special offers available.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable and Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was clean, spacious and the bed very comfortable and the option of having more pillows in the room, a welcome addition.
reviews.title: Another great Premier Inn with views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location for visiting bridlington,lincoln, cleethorpes and Hull itself!The Humber Bridge is nearby and the Hotel offers great views of it,their is also an excellent viewing area park 200 yards away.The hotel has good parking and easy access to the A63/M62,the receptionists were very helpful and welcoming and the room was clean and quite large for a budjet hotel.The adjoining "Brewers Fayre" bar and restaurant was very "amiable",with lots of offers on drinks and food!
reviews.title: good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night while looking around the area, Good location just at the end of the Humber Bridge. Friendly welcome, room clean, overlooking the car park, but were not disturbed by noise at all, and the place was very busy. Plenty of tea/coffee etc,.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: We had a meal at the Brewers Fayre next door, excellent, as was the breakfast!
reviews.title: Great family stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our second visit there and look forward to returning.
reviews.title: 2nd time not so lucky!

reviews.text: Booked a £29 room for a weekend break with hubby and kids to visit the deep. Nice location with a country park just down the road and views of the Humber Bridge. Great Brewyers Fayre attached which is very family friendly with a small soft play and family dining area downstairs. Room was spotless and my girls had a double sofa bed to share to sleep on. We opted for the meal deal value and the kids ate free at breakfast great choice of food on both menus and the quality and taste was excellent. We will definately stay here again when looking for a cheap break as lots to do nearby and appreciate the family friendly pub atmosphere.
reviews.title: Thank you

reviews.text: Very easy to find. Very large car park. Good sized rooms, comfy beds and well looked after (to be expected in most Premier Inn's) Pub next door was ok, meals deals at two for £10 is a good deal but although advertised open till late, it never was. If you want to venture out a taxi to the Hull City centre is £15 each way. However if you do go out, never expect to re-enter the hotel swiftly as door bells seem to fall on deaf ears...
reviews.title: Not the best!

reviews.text: Good hotel, but relativly shabby service.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: Was very clean, standard Premier Inn quality. Asked for 2 rooms together but on arrival they were on different floors but they managed to re-arrange. Location just near Humber bridge which you can see from the restaurant, About 20 min drive into Hull. Breakfast very good but you have to pay extra. Have since stayed at the Innkeepers Lodge which I feel is better quality.
reviews.title: Fantastic for price and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall ok, but just needs a little extra in service quality, but nothing too bad.
reviews.title: After many unsuccessful stays here - we will go elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got the £29 rate for one night on business, the room was very clean as was the bathroom. The hotel is only a few minutes outside of the City if you have car and is actually located in a really quite and nice area even though there is a big main road, it is quiet as the hotel is far back off it. Nice pub next door also. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Have already booked again.
